creator: cailiecrane@hotmail.com
text:
I am running ASP on Apache. The ASP component is "activeHTML" (ATHML.exe).
When I stop Apache, it should terminate the cgi-program (AHTML.exe). However, 
sometimes when my application crashes (i'm developing something that's hard to 
explain), I have to stop the server. I notice that sometimes when Apache 
stops, it doesn't kill the AHMTL.exe process, and I have to kill it myself.

That is probably not too helpful. But I thought you should know.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Are you using a module to run your ASP?  If so, you'll probably need to
take this up with the developers of that module, since they are responsible
for how it handles child processes.

yes, i did contact them about this. they said that apache should terminate the 
ahtml.exe process when it stops.

?? hmm?
creator: cailiecrane@hotmail.com

text:
I'm sorry, but since we have absolutely no knowledge of what this other
module is doing, there is really no way we can help.  It may be a bug in
apache, or it may not, but we can't do anything about it because we
have no idea what is going on.  You should probably go back to the module
supplier again.
creator: slive@apache.org
